instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..
definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the screen of the device that allows you to see what is on the screen. When this is low or missing, the screen will be dim..

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Backlight
threads.message:
Hello,
Confirmed NoB-ack Light. Display is fine - Checked on another machine - No Flexgate.
Voltage on <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> is 0V

Ohms Reading is keeps increasing and ultimately stops at 167.5 kOhms . Checked at <CAPACITOR>C8473</CAPACITOR>

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Backlight
threads.message:
Any history available?
Do you get image, only missing backlight?

Check 3V3/<SIGNAL>5V_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> voltage.

threads.message: With display connected?? These are on the other side of the board

Also, if you plan to stay in this business, should get all necessary things which help your jobs.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Backlight
threads.message:
Thank you for guidance.

Yes i get image only Backlight missing. I can see the apple logo with a flashlight .

No history available. The board looks clean.

L7690 is a bit rusty but i get voltage there.

3V3 and <SIGNAL>5V_S0SW</SIGNAL> is fine.

<SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> is 3.28V

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Backlight
threads.message:
First step, check F8400.
Be sure all resistors around <CHIP>U8400</CHIP> have correct ohm value (not to ground).
Pay atention to the resistors connected to SCL/SDA lines.
Also check voltage and diode mode to ground on these lines.

Post diode mode to ground readings at both pins of <DIODE>D8410</DIODE>.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Backlight
threads.message:
Ohms Value ( Not to Ground)
F8400 1.1 Ohms

<RESISTOR>R8444</RESISTOR> - 1.4 Ohms
<RESISTOR>R8410</RESISTOR> - 13.4 Ohms
<RESISTOR>R8453</RESISTOR> - 1.2 Ohms
<RESISTOR>R8452</RESISTOR> - 1.2 Ohms
<RESISTOR>R8450</RESISTOR> - 0.7 Ohms
<RESISTOR>R8451</RESISTOR> - 0.7 Ohms
<RESISTOR>R8442</RESISTOR> - 1.1 Ohms
<RESISTOR>R8445</RESISTOR> - 0.7 Ohms
<RESISTOR>R8440</RESISTOR> - 1.01 M Ohms
<RESISTOR>R8431</RESISTOR> - 17 KOhms and keeps on increasing.
<RESISTOR>R8432</RESISTOR> - 60K Ohms and keeps increasing ( Sometimes shows 3.8 M Ohms and decreases)

Diode Mode Reading (Red to Ground)
<DIODE>D8410</DIODE> 
Pin 1 is .894
Pin 2 is 1.228

SCL/SDA line resistor is .557

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Backlight
threads.message:
For high value resistors, is normal to get lower readings measuring them onboard.
However, can't get short (1.2 ohm) for <RESISTOR>R8452</RESISTOR>/3.
Please, recheck their values.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Backlight
threads.message:
"<RESISTOR>R8432</RESISTOR> - 60K Ohms and keeps increasing ( Sometimes shows 3.8 M Ohms and decreases"
High value resistors must be measured disconnected from circuit.
Desolder one pin and check it then; is more easy to measure than out of board.

Also check all traces continuity.
